code: @Manual{,   title = {daterangepicker: Create a Shiny Date-Range Input},   author = {Sebastian Gatscha},   year = {2023},   note = {https://github.com/trafficonese/daterangepicker/, https://www.daterangepicker.com, https://trafficonese.github.io/daterangepicker/}, }

title: Create a Shiny Date-Range Input
text: Custom Shiny input binding Date Range Picker.

title: Create a Shiny Date-Range Input
text: dev version:

title: Create a Shiny Date-Range Input
text: basic example Date Range Picker: examples /inst/examples/
code: library(shiny) library(daterangepicker)  ## UI ########################## ui <- fluidPage(   daterangepicker(     inputId = "daterange",     label = "Pick a Date",     start = Sys.Date() - 30, end = Sys.Date(),     style = "width:100%; border-radius:4px",     icon = icon("calendar")   ),   verbatimTextOutput("print"),   actionButton("act", "Update Daterangepicker"), )  ## SERVER ########################## server <- function(input, output, session) {   output$print <- renderPrint({     req(input$daterange)     input$daterange   })   observeEvent(input$act, {     updateDaterangepicker(session, "daterange",                           start = Sys.Date(),                            end = Sys.Date() - 100)   }) }  shinyApp(ui, server)

title: daterangepicker — daterangepicker
text: Date Range Picker pops two calendars selecting dates, times, predefined ranges like "Yesterday", "Last 30 Days", etc.

title: daterangepicker — daterangepicker
code: daterangepicker(   inputId = NULL,   label = "Select a Date",   start = NULL,   end = NULL,   min = NULL,   max = NULL,   ranges = NULL,   rangeNames = names(ranges),   language = "en",   style = "width:100%;border-radius:4px;text-align:center;",   class = NULL,   icon = NULL,   options = daterangepickerOptions() )

title: daterangepicker — daterangepicker
text: inputId input ID label label control, NULL label. start beginning date initially selected. Must Date / POSIXt string. NULL default current day. end end date initially selected date range. Must Date / POSIXt string. NULL default current day. min earliest date user may select. Must Date string max latest date user may select. Must Date string ranges Set predefined date ranges user can select . key label range, value array two dates representing bounds range. Alternatively, labels can specified via `rangeNames`. argument used, `ranges` named `rangeNames` take precedence. rangeNames Optional character vector specifying labels predefined date ranges. specified, override names `ranges`. language language used month day names. Default "en". See Multiple Locale Support list valid values. style Add CSS-styles input. class Custom class icon Icon display next label. options List options. See daterangepickerOptions

title: daterangepicker — daterangepicker
code: if (interactive()) {   library(shiny)   library(daterangepicker)   ## UI ##########################   ui <- fluidPage(     tags$head(tags$style(".myclass {background-color: #96dafb;}")),     daterangepicker(       inputId = "daterange",       label = "Pick a Date",       start = Sys.Date() - 30, end = Sys.Date(),       max = Sys.Date(),       language = "en",       ranges = list(         "Today" = Sys.Date(),         "Yesterday" = Sys.Date() - 1,         "Last 3 days" = c(Sys.Date() - 2, Sys.Date()),         "Last 7 days" = c(Sys.Date() - 6, Sys.Date())       ),       style = "width:100%; border-radius:4px",       class = "myclass",       icon = icon("calendar")     ),     verbatimTextOutput("print"),     actionButton("act", "Update Daterangepicker"),   )   ## SERVER ##########################   server <- function(input, output, session) {     output$print <- renderPrint({       req(input$daterange)       input$daterange     })     observeEvent(input$act, {       updateDaterangepicker(         session, "daterange",         start = Sys.Date(),         end = Sys.Date() - 100,         ranges = list(           Sys.Date(), Sys.Date() - 1,           c(Sys.Date() - 3, Sys.Date()),           c(Sys.Date() - 6, Sys.Date()),           Sys.Date() + 2         ),         rangeNames = c(           "Today", "Yesterday", "Last 3 days",           "Last 7 days", "The day after tomorrow \u263a"         ),         max = Sys.Date() + 2       )     })   }   shinyApp(ui, server) }

title: daterangepickerOptions — daterangepickerOptions
text: Update daterangepicker

title: daterangepickerOptions — daterangepickerOptions
code: daterangepickerOptions(   minYear = NULL,   maxYear = NULL,   showDropdowns = TRUE,   showCustomRangeLabel = TRUE,   opens = c("right", "left", "center"),   drops = c("down", "up"),   timePicker = FALSE,   timePickerIncrement = 1,   timePicker24Hour = FALSE,   timePickerSeconds = FALSE,   showWeekNumbers = FALSE,   showISOWeekNumbers = FALSE,   parentEl = NULL,   maxSpan = NULL,   alwaysShowCalendars = FALSE,   buttonClasses = NULL,   applyButtonClasses = NULL,   cancelButtonClasses = NULL,   cancelIsClear = FALSE,   locale = NULL,   singleDatePicker = FALSE,   autoApply = FALSE,   linkedCalendars = TRUE,   autoUpdateInput = TRUE,   ... )

title: daterangepickerOptions — daterangepickerOptions
text: minYear minimum year numeric shown dropdowns showDropdowns set TRUE maxYear maximum year numeric shown dropdowns showDropdowns set TRUE showDropdowns Show year month select boxes calendars jump specific month year. showCustomRangeLabel Displays "Custom Range" end list predefined ranges, ranges option used. option highlighted whenever current date range selection match one predefined ranges. Clicking display calendars select new range. opens Whether picker appears aligned left, right, center HTML element attached . drops Whether picker appears () () HTML element attached . Default timePicker Adds select boxes choose times addition dates. timePickerIncrement Increment minutes selection list times (.e. 30 allow selection times ending 0 30). timePicker24Hour Use 24-hour instead 12-hour times, removing /PM selection. timePickerSeconds Show seconds timePicker. showWeekNumbers Show localized week numbers start week calendars. showISOWeekNumbers Show ISO week numbers start week calendars. parentEl jQuery selector parent element date range picker added , provided 'body' maxSpan maximum span selected start end dates List table. can provide object moment library let add date. alwaysShowCalendars Normally, use ranges option specify pre-defined date ranges, calendars choosing custom date range shown user clicks "Custom Range". option set TRUE, calendars choosing custom date range always shown instead. buttonClasses CSS class names added apply cancel buttons. applyButtonClasses CSS class names added apply button. cancelButtonClasses CSS class names added cancel button. cancelIsClear TRUE, treat Cancel Button like Clear Button. locale Allows provide localized strings buttons labels, customize date format, change first day week calendars. See examples `./inst/examples/` singleDatePicker Show single calendar choose one date, instead range picker two calendars. start end dates provided callback single date chosen. autoApply Hide apply cancel buttons, automatically apply new date range soon two dates clicked. linkedCalendars enabled, two calendars displayed always two sequential months (.e. January February), advanced clicking left right arrows calendars. disabled, two calendars can individually advanced display month/year. autoUpdateInput Indicates whether date range picker automatically update value <input> element attached initialization selected dates change. ... arguments passed `daterangepicker`, like isInvalidDate isCustomDate.

title: updateDaterangepicker — updateDaterangepicker
text: session session object passed function given shinyServer. inputId input ID label label control, NULL label. start beginning date initially selected. Must Date / POSIXt string. NULL default current day. end end date initially selected date range. Must Date / POSIXt string. NULL default current day. min earliest date user may select. Must Date string max latest date user may select. Must Date string icon Icon display next label. options List options. See daterangepickerOptions ranges Set predefined date ranges user can select . key label range, value array two dates representing bounds range. Alternatively, labels can specified via `rangeNames`. argument used, `ranges` named `rangeNames` take precedence. rangeNames Optional character vector specifying labels predefined date ranges. specified, override names `ranges`. style Add CSS-styles input. class Custom class
